item.title: Ninja Gaiden 2 Remastered Drops Today on Xbox – ‘Ninja Gaiden 2 Black’
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/ninja-gaiden-2-black-remastered-xbox-game-pass/

It was just revealed at the Xbox Developer Direct showcase that Ninja Gaiden 2 Remastered – known as ‘Ninja Gaiden 2 Black’ – drops today on Xbox Game Pass. This shadowdrop comes courtesy of Team Ninja, who revealed Ninja Gaiden 4 just moments before announcing the sudden and unexpected arrival of the rebuilt Ninja Gaiden 2.

You can play Ninja Gaiden 2 Black now, and it’s guaranteed to keep you busy until Ninja Gaiden 4 is released in Fall 2025.

Back in Black

Ninja Gaiden 2 Black has been built in UE5 by Team Ninja, honouring the ‘original style of the game’ with lush visuals. There will be a string of playable characters, including Ayane, Momiji, Rachel, and of course, Ryu Hayabusa.

item.title: Ninja Gaiden 4 Announced At Xbox Developer Direct
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/ninja-gaiden-4-announced-at-xbox-developer-direct/

A new Ninja Gaiden game is on its away. From developers Team Ninja and Platinum Games, Ninja Gaiden 4 was announced during the Xbox Developer Direct on Thursday.

The game’s announcement confirms the rumors that a “legendary Japanese IP” was going to see a game announced during the annual event.

“To all the ‘Master Ninja’ around the world, after more than 10 years, the wait is finally over,” Team Ninja’s Fumihiko Yasuda said. “We’re excited to announce Ninja Gaiden 4, a new mainline entry in this high-speed action series, where you become the ultimate ninja and take on relentless enemies in fierce combat.”

Ninja Gaiden will release in Fall 2025 on Xbox Series X|S, PlayStation 5, and PC. The game will also be available day one on Xbox Game Pass.

In addition to the announcement of Ninja Gaiden 4, Koei Tecmo announced Ninja Gaiden 2 Black. Built in Unreal Engine 5, Ninja Gaiden 2 Black is a remake of the game from 2008. It’s available starting today on PC, console, and Xbox Game Pass.

item.title: Gray Zone Warfare Turned Heads in 2024 – What’s Next For the Tactical Shooter?
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/gray-zone-warfare-whats-next/

Gray Zone Warfare was released in April 2024, and while the launch was ‘far from flawless’ (as the dev says), it made a splash in the tactical shooter scene and attracted stacks of players. It stormed up the charts on streaming platforms, and as 2024 unravelled, MADFINGER Games coaxed the game into a better space.

Today, Gray Zone Warfare has sold more than 1.5 million units, and at the peak, 322,600 players were concurrently exploring this open-world, intense game. In a recent press release, MADFINGER doubled back to look at the game’s performance in 2024 before dipping into what comes next for Gray Zone Warfare.

‘Build the Game with Them’

In a recent press release, MADFINGER Games said they invite ‘you to build the game with them’. In the months ahead, Gray Zone Warfare will receive two major updates, introducing key elements like deeper and richer PvP content and a dynamic weather system.

It was just weeks ago that MADFINGER rolled out the Night Ops update, which was a pivotal point for the game that pushed it into new territory in terms of review sentiment on Steam.

Through 2024, MADFINGER Games fixed 2163 bugs, according to data revealed in the aforementioned press release. Many of these fixes were spread across the 19 releases pushed throughout the year.

Gray Zone Warfare isn’t your average tactical shooter. It blends a few genres, offering players a unique ‘extraction shooter’ feel in a wide, open world that isn’t bound by a raid timer. It has survival elements, including health mechanics, weight management, and the need to stay fed and watered.

Players are invited to join factions, spawning at a starting base that they’ll use to get kitted, call in a helicopter, and jet off across the map – a fictional, sprawling world called Lamang. It’s visually sumptuous and intense, and I had the chance to play it before it landed in early access last year. I loved every minute.

If you want to give Gray Zone Warfare a try, you can pick up a copy on Steam. Let us know what you think on the Insider Gaming forum.
